en.hero_title: Our mission is to enable free, world-class education, skill development, and rural & women empowerment ‚Äî for anyone, anywhere.
en.hero_flagship: Flagship Project: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Gyan-Ganga
en.hero_tagline: No fees. No charity. Only opportunity.
en.about_p1: Asha Jyoti Rural Udaan Foundation is a non-profit organization dedicated to empowering rural students, youth, women, and farmers through education, skill development, and self-reliance initiatives.
en.about_p2: We work at the grassroots level to ensure that rural talent is never limited due to lack of access, guidance, or opportunity.
en.prog6_title: Farmer Training for Modern & Sustainable Agriculture
en.vision_p1: Our vision is to build a self-reliant, empowered society where rural talent is never limited by lack of education, skills, or guidance.
en.vision_p2: Through Asha Jyoti Rural Udaan Foundation and its flagship initiative, Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Gyan-Ganga, we aim to create sustainable learning and empowerment ecosystems across rural India ‚Äî nurturing confident students, skilled youth, empowered women, and progressive farmers.
en.vision_p3: Inspired by the ideals of leadership, courage, and nation-building, our long-term goal is to expand this model into multiple regions, ensuring equal opportunity, dignity, and growth for every aspiring individual.
en.founder_designation: Entrepreneur, Social Reformer, and Education & Youth Visionary
en.founder_bio: Ravi P. Upadhyay is working at the grassroots level to strengthen rural education, skill development, and leadership. He is the Founder of Asha Jyoti Rural Udaan Foundation, inspired by Indian values and the legacy of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj.
en.founder_quote: "My vision is to ensure that rural talent is never limited due to lack of education, skills, or guidance."
en.recognition_intro: The foundation has received messages and acknowledgements from distinguished dignitaries and coverage in media publications, reflecting growing national recognition of its mission and impact.
en.recog2_desc: Featured in national and regional publications
en.wishes_intro: Watch messages of support and best wishes from distinguished dignitaries for the launch of our flagship project.
en.footer_disclaimer: A registered non-profit organization dedicated to rural empowerment through education and skill development.
en.footer_copyright: ¬© 2026 Asha Jyoti Rural Udaan Foundation. All rights reserved.
en.aside_inaug_tagline: A step towards free, world-class education and skill development
en.apply_desc: Express your interest in our programs
en.volunteer_desc: Join us in making a difference
en.donate_desc: Your contribution helps empower rural communities
en.home_flagship_description: A holistic education, skill, and empowerment campus inspired by leadership, courage, discipline, and nation-building values.
en.home_cta_title: Join Us in Making a Difference
en.gyan_overview_p1: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Gyan Ganga is the flagship education and skill development program of Asha Jyoti Rural Udaan Foundation, dedicated to providing free, inclusive, and high-quality learning opportunities to children and youth from rural and underserved communities.
en.gyan_overview_p2: Inspired by the idea of Gyan as a sacred and continuous river, the program envisions knowledge as a force that uplifts individuals, strengthens communities, and shapes the future of the nation. Across rural India, countless learners possess immense potential but are held back by financial constraints, limited access to guidance, and lack of exposure. Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Gyan Ganga was created to bridge this gap by ensuring that education reaches every deserving learner with dignity and purpose.
en.gyan_overview_p3: Rooted in the timeless values of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj‚Äîself-reliance, discipline, courage, and leadership‚Äîthe program goes beyond traditional classroom education. It integrates academic learning with skill development, ethical values, and practical exposure, preparing learners not just to succeed academically, but to become confident, capable, and responsible citizens.
en.gyan_overview_p4: More than a program, Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Gyan Ganga represents a long-term movement toward educational equity‚Äîfocused not on charity, but on creating sustainable opportunities that enable individuals to rise, contribute, and lead with self-respect.
en.gyan_problem_subtitle: Why Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Gyan Ganga Is Needed?
en.gyan_problem_p1: Despite India's demographic advantage, a large section of children and youth in rural and underserved communities continues to face systemic barriers to education and skill development. Quality learning opportunities remain unevenly distributed, leaving many capable learners without the support needed to realise their potential.
en.gyan_problem_p2: Challenges such as financial constraints, inadequate infrastructure, shortage of trained educators, lack of career guidance, and limited exposure to modern skills result in high dropout rates and underprepared youth. Formal education, where available, often remains disconnected from real-world requirements, leading to unemployment or underemployment even among educated individuals.
en.gyan_problem_p3: These gaps do not reflect a lack of talent, but a lack of access, direction, and sustained support. Without timely intervention, generations of learners remain trapped in cycles of limited opportunity, affecting not only individuals but entire communities.
en.gyan_problem_p4: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Gyan Ganga addresses this critical need by recognizing education as a pathway to dignity, self-reliance, and long-term social transformation‚Äînot merely as a means of certification.
en.gyan_inauguration_venue:
Village - Upadhan, Kusarana
Tahsil - Kerakat
District - Jaunpur
State - Uttar Pradesh
en.gyan_inauguration_dignitary: Honourable Chhatrapati Rajarshi Shahu Maharaj Saheb of Kolhapur
en.gyan_inauguration_p1: The Bhoomipujan ceremony of the {name} project will be held on {date} in {location}.
en.gyan_inauguration_p2: The campus will feature a grand equestrian statue of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, symbolizing courage, discipline, self-respect, and national duty.
en.gyan_inauguration_p3: The ceremony will be graced by the presence of {dignitary}.
en.gyan_values_title: Values Inspired by Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj
en.value1_desc: Shivaji Maharaj believed that true strength comes from wisdom and foresight. Gyan Ganga is rooted in the belief that education is the strongest foundation for individual and societal progress.
en.value2_desc: Swarajya was built by empowering people with skills and responsibility. Our initiatives aim to nurture self-reliant youth, women, and farmers through education and skill development.
en.value3_desc: Shivaji Maharaj's governance stood for fairness, dignity, and equal treatment for all. We aspire to create inclusive learning spaces, where background does not limit potential.
en.value4_desc: One of Shivaji Maharaj's most defining values was deep respect for women. Our plans include women empowerment and entrepreneurship, enabling confidence, independence, and leadership.
en.value5_desc: Swarajya was not for personal gain, but for the welfare of people. Gyan Ganga is envisioned as a free, community-driven initiative, serving rural society without discrimination.
en.value6_desc: Shivaji Maharaj planned not just for his time, but for generations ahead. Our foundation is committed to sustainable, long-term impact in education, livelihoods, and rural development.
en.gyan_cta_desc: Express your interest and we'll get back to you with more information.

en.library_overview:
Overview

The Modern Library & Study Center is a core pillar of Asha Jyoti Rural Udaan Foundation, designed to provide rural students and youth with a disciplined, resource-rich, and future-ready learning environment.

Developed under our flagship project Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Gyan-Ganga, this center goes beyond traditional libraries. It functions as a career-launch platform, blending books, digital learning, mentorship, and structured study support.
en.library_objectives:
Objectives of the Library & Study Center

  • To provide a quiet, disciplined study environment for serious learners
  • To ensure free access to quality books and reference material
  • To bridge the digital divide through e-learning and computer facilities
  • To support competitive exam preparation and career planning
  • To build a culture of self-study, confidence, and lifelong learning
en.library_facilities:
Key Facilities & Features

üìö Modern Reading & Reference Library

  • Wide collection of academic, competitive exam, and reference books
  • Subject-wise and exam-wise organized shelves
  • Newspapers and educational magazines
  • Open-access reading space with natural lighting

ü™ë Silent Study Zone

  • Individual study desks with ergonomic seating
  • Distraction-free environment for long study hours
  • Ideal for competitive exam aspirants and senior students
  • Clearly defined library discipline and study rules
en.library_programs:
Programme Details

üìò 1. Structured Study Programme

Daily access to a quiet, disciplined study environment. Fixed study hours for morning and evening learners. Ideal for school & college students, competitive exam aspirants, and first-generation learners.

Outcome: Development of focus, consistency, and exam-oriented study habits.

üìó 2. Competitive Examination Preparation Support

Dedicated support for UPSC / State PSC, SSC / Banking, Defence / Police / Railway. Availability of standard reference books, syllabus copies & exam calendars, preparation strategies & guidance notes.

Outcome: Improved success rate and informed exam planning.

üíª 3. E-Library Programme

Guided access to government e-learning portals, online educational platforms, recorded lectures and digital notes. Basic digital literacy for rural students.

Outcome: Bridging the digital divide and improving digital confidence.

üìñ 4. Reading Culture & Knowledge Enhancement Programme

Promotion of daily reading habits. Access to newspapers, current affairs magazines, general knowledge resources. Special focus on Indian Constitution, Indian economy, national history & leadership values.

Outcome: Awareness, analytical thinking, and informed citizenship.
en.library_impact:
Impact We Aim to Create

Through the Modern Library & Study Center, we aim to:

  • Improve academic performance of rural students
  • Increase success in competitive examinations
  • Build confidence, discipline, and self-belief
  • Create strong foundations for higher education & employment
  • Establish a permanent knowledge hub for rural transformation
en.library_belief:
Our Belief

A disciplined environment, quality resources, and the right guidance can transform rural potential into national strength.
en.library_cta:
Call to Action

We welcome educators, mentors, volunteers, CSR partners, and well-wishers to support and strengthen this Modern Library & Study Center.

Together, we build knowledge.
Together, we build the nation.
en.digital_overview:
Overview

The Digital E-Learning & Computer Facility is a core programme of Asha Jyoti Rural Udaan Foundation, developed under its flagship initiative Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Gyan-Ganga.

This programme aims to bridge the digital divide by providing rural students, youth, women, and first-generation learners with access to computers, digital education, online learning resources, and essential technology skills required in today's world.
en.digital_objectives:
Programme Objectives

  • To provide basic to intermediate computer education for rural learners
  • To enable access to online education platforms and digital content
  • To support students in school, college, and competitive exam preparation
  • To build digital confidence and employability skills among youth
  • To ensure rural learners are not left behind in the digital era
en.digital_components:
Programme Components

üíª 1. Computer Education Programme

  • Basic computer operations (hardware & software awareness)
  • Operating systems & file management
  • Internet usage, email communication, and online safety
  • Introduction to office productivity tools

Outcome: Digital confidence and essential computer literacy.

üåê 2. Digital E-Learning Programme

Guided access to government e-learning portals (SWAYAM, DIKSHA, etc.), online academic resources, recorded lectures and digital courses. Support for school, college, and exam-oriented learning.

Outcome: Equal access to quality digital education resources.

üéØ 3. Competitive Exam & Academic Support

Online test series access (selected & guided), digital notes, PDFs, and syllabus material. Support for competitive examinations and academic revision & preparation.

Outcome: Improved exam readiness and structured preparation.

üßë‚Äçüíº 4. Digital Skills for Employability

Basic digital workplace skills, online form filling & applications, resume preparation support, introduction to digital tools used in modern jobs.

Outcome: Enhanced employability and job readiness.

üë© 5. Digital Literacy for Women & First-Generation Learners

Special sessions for women and beginners, confidence-building through hands-on practice, safe and supportive learning environment.

Outcome: Inclusion, confidence, and empowerment through technology.
en.digital_facility:
Facility Details

üñ•Ô∏è Computer Lab Infrastructure

  • Desktop / laptop systems with updated software
  • Ergonomic seating and study-friendly layout
  • Headphones for online learning sessions
  • Controlled and safe internet connectivity

üìñ Digital Learning Resources

  • E-books, PDFs, and scanned notes
  • Recorded lectures and curated online content
  • Subject-wise digital folders and access system

üßë‚Äçüè´ Supervised Learning Environment

  • Trained facilitators / volunteers for guidance
  • Structured learning hours
  • Assistance for beginners and slow learners
en.digital_impact:
Impact We Aim to Create

Through the Digital E-Learning & Computer Facility, we aim to:

  • Reduce the digital gap between rural and urban learners
  • Improve academic and competitive exam performance
  • Increase digital literacy and confidence
  • Enhance employment readiness and opportunities
  • Create digitally empowered rural communities
en.digital_belief:
Our Belief

Digital access is no longer a privilege‚Äîit is a necessity. Empowering rural learners with technology is empowering the nation's future.
en.digital_cta:
Call to Action

We welcome educators, digital trainers, volunteers, CSR partners, and technology supporters to help us strengthen and expand this Digital E-Learning & Computer Facility.

Together, we connect minds.
Together, we build the future.
en.textile_overview:
Overview

Integrated Textile Skill Development Course is a comprehensive, employment-focused training initiative of Asha Jyoti Rural Udaan Foundation, implemented under its flagship project Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Gyan-Ganga.

The course is designed to develop industry-ready skilled manpower across the complete textile value chain‚Äîfrom spinning and yarn dyeing to weaving operations, quality inspection, design, accounts, production management, and processing & garment industry requirements.
en.textile_objective:
Programme Objective

To equip rural youth with practical, job-oriented textile skills that lead directly to employment, apprenticeship, or skill up-gradation across textile mills, weaving units, processing houses, and garment factories.
en.textile_highlights:
Course Highlights

  • End-to-end textile industry coverage
  • Modular, job-role‚Äìbased structure
  • Strong emphasis on hands-on training and shop-floor discipline
  • Multiple entry and exit options
  • Aligned with real industry requirements
en.textile_structure:
Course Structure

Duration: 6‚Äì12 months (module-wise flexibility)

Training Mode: 70% Practical | 30% Guided Theory

Eligibility:

  • Operator roles: 8th / 10th pass
  • Technician & supervisor roles: 12th / ITI / Diploma
  • Design, accounts & management roles: Graduate preferred
en.textile_modules:
Skill Modules Covered (End-to-End)

Yarn & Pre-Weaving

  • Spinning & Yarn Manufacturing
  • Yarn Dyeing & Colour Application
  • Warping Process
  • Sizing / Seizing Process
  • Beam Drawing & Loom Preparation
  • Beam Mounting on Weaving Machines

Weaving Operations

  • Weaving Machine Operator (Handloom / Powerloom / Shuttleless)
  • Weaving Machine Technician & Maintenance Support

Quality, Design & Management

  • Fabric Checking & Quality Inspection
  • Textile Design & Product Development
  • Textile Accounts & Costing
  • Weaving Production Planning & Management

Add-On Industry Skills

  • Processing Unit Skill Development
  • Garment Industry Skill Requirements
en.textile_certification:
Certification (Role-Based)

Participants receive module-wise or role-based certification, such as:

  • Certificate in Spinning & Yarn Manufacturing
  • Certificate in Yarn Dyeing Operations
  • Certificate in Warping & Sizing Processes
  • Certificate in Weaving Machine Operation
  • Certificate in Textile Machine Maintenance
  • Certificate in Fabric Quality Inspection
  • Certificate in Textile Design Fundamentals
  • Certificate in Textile Accounts & Costing
  • Certificate in Weaving Production Management
  • Certificate in Processing & Garment Industry Skills
en.textile_outcomes:
Career Outcomes

  • Employment in textile mills, weaving units, processing houses & garment factories
  • Apprenticeship and skill up-gradation opportunities
  • Clear growth path from operator ‚Üí technician ‚Üí supervisor ‚Üí manager
  • Sustainable livelihood and long-term career in the textile industry
en.textile_approach:
Our Approach

We focus on practical skills, industry discipline, and complete process understanding to build confident, employable textile professionals.

Interested in joining, partnering, or supporting this programme?
üëâ Contact us to learn more about enrolment, collaboration, or CSR participation.
en.women_overview:
WOMEN EMPOWERMENT & LIVELIHOOD SKILL DEVELOPMENT

Skill Modules for Rural Village Women (Simple ‚Ä¢ Practical ‚Ä¢ Income-Oriented)
en.women_foundation:
üåº FOUNDATION & CONFIDENCE MODULES

(Very important for rural women)

  • Self-Confidence & Awareness for Rural Women
  • Basic Communication & Social Interaction Skills
  • Health, Hygiene & Family Well-being Awareness
en.women_livelihood:
üß∂ HOME-BASED LIVELIHOOD SKILLS

(Easy to learn, work from home)

  • Basic Stitching, Tailoring & Alteration Skills
  • Hand Embroidery, Decorative & Craft Work
  • Textile-Based Home Work (Thread cutting, checking, folding, packing)
  • Simple Handicraft & Handmade Product Skills
en.women_food:
üç≤ FOOD & LOCAL BUSINESS SKILLS

(High demand in villages)

  • Homemade Food Products (Papad, Pickle, Snacks, Masala, Milk & Milk product)
  • Food Packing, Hygiene & Quality Practices
  • Small Tiffin / Catering Support Skills
en.women_shg:
ü§ù GROUP & SHG-BASED WORK MODULES

(Strong model for rural women)

  • Self-Help Group (SHG) Formation & Working
  • Group Production & Shared Work Culture
  • Simple Record Keeping for SHGs
en.women_enterprise:
üß∫ SMALL ENTERPRISE & MARKET SKILLS

(Selling locally)

  • Local Market Selling & Customer Handling
  • Basic Pricing & Profit Understanding
  • Simple Packaging & Product Presentation
en.women_growth:
üå± OPTIONAL GROWTH MODULES

(For interested women)

  • Government Schemes for Women (Awareness Only)
  • Small Business Expansion Basics
  • Leadership Skills for SHG Leaders
en.women_environment:
Learning Environment & Approach

  • Safe, respectful, and women-friendly learning space
  • Group discussions and interactive sessions
  • Practical, easy-to-understand guidance
  • Encouraging participation and peer learning
en.women_beneficiaries:
Target Beneficiaries

  • Rural and semi-urban women
  • Women seeking self-employment opportunities
  • Women from economically weaker backgrounds
  • Members of self-help groups and aspiring entrepreneurs
en.women_impact:
Impact We Aim to Create

Through the Women Empowerment & Entrepreneurship Guidance Programme, we aim to:

  • Enable women to become economically independent
  • Strengthen women-led micro-enterprises
  • Improve household income stability
  • Build confidence, leadership, and decision-making ability
  • Create role models for future generations
en.women_belief:
Our Belief

When women are empowered with skills, confidence, and opportunity, entire families and communities move forward.
en.women_cta:
Call to Action

We welcome mentors, trainers, women leaders, CSR partners, and well-wishers to support and strengthen this Women Empowerment & Entrepreneurship Guidance Programme.

Together, we empower women.
Together, we build stronger communities.
en.career_overview:
Overview

The Career Counselling & Competitive Examination Guidance programme is an important academic initiative of Asha Jyoti Rural Udaan Foundation, designed to support rural students and youth in making informed career decisions and structured exam preparations.

Implemented under the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Gyan-Ganga project, this programme addresses one of the biggest challenges faced by rural learners‚Äîlack of proper guidance, exposure, and direction.

The focus is on helping students understand career options, examination pathways, preparation strategies, and long-term goals in a clear and realistic manner.
en.career_purpose:
Purpose of the Programme

  • To help students identify suitable career paths based on aptitude and interest
  • To provide accurate and timely guidance for competitive examinations
  • To reduce confusion, stress, and misinformation among students
  • To support structured, goal-oriented preparation
  • To build confidence, motivation, and decision-making ability
en.career_counselling:
Career Counselling Support

üéØ One-to-One Career Counselling

  • Individual guidance sessions for students and youth
  • Understanding interests, strengths, and academic background
  • Career mapping for higher education, government examinations, skill-based and professional careers
en.career_awareness:
üß≠ Career Awareness & Direction

  • Information on various career opportunities
  • Guidance on educational pathways, required qualifications, timeframes and preparation stages
  • Special focus on first-generation learners
en.career_exam_guidance:
Competitive Examination Guidance

üìù Examination-Oriented Support

Guidance for preparation of major competitive examinations such as:

  • UPSC and State Public Service Commissions
  • SSC, Banking, and other central examinations
  • Defence, Police, Railway, and similar examinations
  • State-level and departmental competitive exams
en.career_planning:
üìÖ Preparation Planning & Strategy

  • Understanding exam patterns and syllabi
  • Study planning and time management guidance
  • Examination calendars and important timelines
  • Strategy sessions for effective preparation
en.career_resources:
üìñ Study Resources & Reference Support

  • Availability of standard reference books
  • Guidance on selecting the right study material
  • Use of current affairs resources and practice material
en.career_mentorship:
Mentorship & Motivation

üë• Group Guidance Sessions

  • Group discussions and interactive sessions
  • Experience-sharing by mentors and achievers
  • Question‚Äìanswer sessions for doubt clarification

üå± Motivation & Confidence Building

  • Regular motivation sessions
  • Stress management and exam mindset support
  • Encouragement to develop discipline and consistency
en.career_environment:
Learning Environment & Discipline

  • Fixed counselling and guidance schedules
  • Structured and respectful interaction environment
  • Confidential and student-centric approach
  • Focus on discipline, sincerity, and commitment
en.career_impact:
Impact We Aim to Create

Through the Career Counselling & Competitive Examination Guidance programme, we aim to:

  • Enable students to make informed career choices
  • Improve success rates in competitive examinations
  • Reduce dropout and misdirection among rural youth
  • Build confidence, clarity, and long-term vision
  • Create responsible, goal-oriented future citizens
en.career_belief:
Our Belief

Right guidance at the right time can change the direction of an entire life.
en.career_cta:
Call to Action

We welcome educators, mentors, counsellors, and well-wishers to support and strengthen this Career Counselling & Competitive Examination Guidance programme and help rural students move forward with clarity and confidence.

Together, we guide aspirations.
Together, we build the future.
en.farmer_overview:
FARMER TRAINING PROGRAMME

Module-Wise Curriculum for Modern & Sustainable Agriculture

A flagship agriculture initiative of Asha Jyoti Rural Udaan Foundation implemented under Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Gyan-Ganga
en.farmer_structure:
Programme Structure (Overview)

Duration: 4‚Äì8 weeks (modular; farmers may attend selected modules)

Training Mode: 60% practical | 40% guided sessions

Method: Demonstrations, field visits, interaction, Q&A

Outcome: Lower costs, higher yields, sustainable income
en.farmer_modules:
Training Modules

MODULE 1: INTRODUCTION TO MODERN & SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE

Focus: Awareness & mindset

Key Topics: What is sustainable agriculture and why it matters, Climate-smart farming basics, Reducing costs while protecting soil and water

Outcome: Clear understanding of modern farming direction, Readiness to adopt improved practices

MODULE 2: SOIL HEALTH MANAGEMENT & SOIL TESTING

Focus: Strong foundation for crops

Key Topics: Importance of soil testing, Understanding soil reports (pH, nutrients), Improving soil fertility naturally, Organic manure, compost, and green manure

Outcome: Healthier soil, Better nutrient management and yields

MODULE 3: SEED SELECTION, TREATMENT & CROP PLANNING

Focus: Right crop, right method

Key Topics: Selecting quality seeds, Seed treatment methods, Crop rotation and intercropping, Seasonal crop planning

Outcome: Reduced crop failure, Improved productivity

MODULE 4: WATER & IRRIGATION MANAGEMENT

Focus: Save water, improve efficiency

Key Topics: Efficient water usage, Drip and sprinkler irrigation awareness, Rainwater harvesting concepts, Scheduling irrigation scientifically

Outcome: Water savings, Better crop growth with less water

MODULE 5: ORGANIC & NATURAL FARMING PRACTICES

Focus: Sustainable inputs

Key Topics: Basics of organic and natural farming, Preparation of compost, bio-inputs, and organic sprays, Reducing chemical dependency

Outcome: Lower input costs, Improved soil and crop health

MODULE 6: INTEGRATED PEST & DISEASE MANAGEMENT (IPM)

Focus: Safe crop protection

Key Topics: Identifying common pests and diseases, Preventive measures, Eco-friendly pest control methods, Safe and responsible pesticide use

Outcome: Reduced crop loss, Safer farming practices

MODULE 7: FARM MECHANISATION & MODERN TOOLS

Focus: Labour saving & efficiency

Key Topics: Introduction to modern farm tools and equipment, Mechanisation options for small farmers, Cost-benefit awareness of machinery

Outcome: Reduced labour dependency, Increased efficiency

MODULE 8: POST-HARVEST MANAGEMENT & VALUE ADDITION

Focus: Reduce losses, increase income

Key Topics: Harvesting at the right time, Cleaning, grading, and storage, Reducing post-harvest losses, Basic value-addition ideas

Outcome: Better prices, Reduced wastage

MODULE 9: FARM ECONOMICS, COSTING & INCOME PLANNING

Focus: Profitability awareness

Key Topics: Cost of cultivation calculation, Input vs output analysis, Simple record keeping, Income planning for the season

Outcome: Better financial decisions, Improved farm profitability

MODULE 10: MARKET LINKAGES & GOVERNMENT SUPPORT AWARENESS

Focus: Selling smarter

Key Topics: Understanding local markets, Collective selling concepts, Awareness of government schemes and support, Crop insurance basics

Outcome: Better market access, Reduced risk and improved returns
en.farmer_methodology:
Training Methodology

  • Field demonstrations
  • Farmer-to-farmer learning
  • Expert interactions
  • Practical problem solving
en.farmer_beneficiaries:
Target Beneficiaries

  • Small and marginal farmers
  • Young and progressive farmers
  • Farmer groups and cooperatives
  • Farmers seeking sustainable solutions
en.farmer_impact:
Programme Impact

  • Improved soil health and yields
  • Reduced input costs
  • Efficient water usage
  • Increased and stable farm income
  • Environment-friendly agriculture practices
en.farmer_belief:
Our Belief

When farmers learn modern and sustainable practices, agriculture becomes profitable, resilient, and future-ready.
en.farmer_cta:
Call to Action

We welcome agriculture experts, progressive farmers, institutions, and CSR partners to support and strengthen this Farmer Training Programme for Modern & Sustainable Agriculture.

Together, we protect the soil.
Together, we secure the future of farming.
